Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Valet \Val"et\ (?; 277), n. [F. valet, OF. vallet, varlet, vaslet. See {Varlet}, and {Vassal}.] [1913 Webster] 1. A male waiting servant; a servant who attends on gentleman's person; a body servant. [1913 Webster]
2. (Man.) A kind of goad or stick with a point of iron. [1913 Webster]
{Valet de chambre}[F.], a body servant, or personal attendant. [1913 Webster]

valet n : a manservant who acts as a personal attendant to his employer; "Jeeves was Bertie Wooster's man" [syn: {valet de chambre}, {gentleman}, {gentleman's gentleman}, {man}] v : serve as a personal attendant to
